President Barack Obama agreed to a cybersecurity pact with Xi Jinping Sept. 25.

The pact was prefaced on both China and the U.S. agreeing that “neither country’s government will conduct or knowingly support cyber-enabled theft of intellectual property, including trade secrets or other confidential business information, with the intent of providing competitive advantages to companies or commercial sectors.” (RELATED: Fool Me Twice … China Attacks Seven Companies After US Cyber Truce)
